Description: Painted wooden shabti of Amenemipet, a priest of Amun, with a black lappet wig, a brown face, the front of the body is painted yellow with a blue collar and the hands are depicted holding two red hoes, the front of the legs is inscribed with hieroglyphs in black paint with red lines to either side, the back is painted white overlain with representations of a red yoke and seed basket and a single line running down the legs, the feet have broken away.
Acquisition name: Purchased from: Somerset Lowry-Corry, 2nd Earl of Belmore
